document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the knowledge of Chinese Gryllacrididae (Orthoptera) VII: Review the genus Apterolarnaca Gorochov, 2004

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Internal spines of male hind femora obviously larger than external ones ( Bian & Shi, 2015 : Fig. 5 ;
Bian et al. , 2016
: Figs. 1D , 2E ; Ingrisch, 2018 : Fig. 39A;
Bian et al. , 2021b
: Fig. 1H ).........................
Apterolarnaca ( Apterolarnaca )
... 2

- Internal spines of male hind femora slightly larger than external ones ( Figs. 5E , 6E , 9J–K )...................................................................................................
Apterolarnaca ( Bianigryllacris )
... 8
2 Middle tibiae without apical spine on dorsal surface.......................................................... 3
- Middle tibiae with apical spine on dorsal surface............................................................ 7

3 Face black and occiput black (
Bian et al. , 2016
: Figs. 1A ), posterior margin of male subgenital plate with 1 U shaped concavity.....................................................................
A. ( A. ) nigrifrontis Bian & Shi, 2016

4 Face with large black mark in middle area (
Bian et al. , 2021b
: Fig. 1A ), posterior concavity of male subgenital plate with narrower at base (
Bian et al. , 2021b
: Fig. 1F, G )................................
A. ( A. ) huanglianensis Bian & Lu, 2021

5 Face with 3 black spots ( Gorochov, 2004 : Fig. 99), male subgenital plate with lateral lobes slightly bifurcate apically ( Gorochov, 2004 : Figs. 101–102); posterior margin of female subgenital plate slightly projected in the middle ( Gorochov, 2004 : Fig. 104)..........................................................................
A. ( A. ) ulla Gorochov, 2004

- Face with 4 black spots (
Bian et al. , 2016: 2
A), male subgenital plate with lateral lobes obviously bifurcate apically (
Bian et al. , 2016: 2
F)........................................................
A. ( A. ) quadrimaculata Bian & Shi, 2016

6 Dorsal surface of body with 1 longitudinal black band along the midline ( Ingrisch, 2018: 39 B); posterior margin of male ninth abdominal tergite with 1 pair of spines ( Ingrisch, 2018: 39 E); posterior concavity of male subgenital plate not projected at middle area; female subgenital plate longer than broad ( Gorochov, 2004 : Fig. 98); basal area of ovipositor with 1 pair of digitate lobes, projecting backward ( Gorochov, 2004 : Fig. 98)..................................
A. ( A. ) apta Gorochov, 2004

7 Frons with broad transverse sulcus (
Bian et al. , 2014
: Fig. 5A, C )..................
A. ( B. ) parvospinus ( Liu & Yin, 2002 )

8 Body almost unicolor without black band on dorsal surface ( Fig. 12 )......................
A. ( B. ) xinganensis
sp. nov.
- Dorsal surface of body with black band along the midline..................................................... 9
9 Apices of fore and middle femora without black stripes...................................................... 10
- Apices of fore and middle femora with black ring-like stripes.................................................. 12
10 Ovipositor with well-developed digitate lateral lobes at base of lower sheaths..................................... 11

- Ovipositor without digitate lateral lobes at base of lower sheaths (
Bian et al. , 2014
: Fig. 2K )....................................................................................................
A. ( B. ) digitatus ( Liu & Bi, 2008 )

11 Posterior concavity of male subgenital plate with 1 bilobed process at basal area (
Bian et al. , 2014
: Fig. 1G ), posterior margin of female subgenital plate rounded (
Bian et al. , 2014
: Fig. 1L )......................
A. ( B. ) bilobus ( Guo & Shi, 2012 )

- Posterior concavity of male subgenital plate not projected in the middle (
Li et al. , 2015
: Fig. 28), female subgenital plate truncate (
Li et al. , 2015
: Fig. 29)...........................................
A. ( B. ) transversa ( Liu, Bi & Zhang, 2010 )

12 The black band of dorsal surface of body only reaching the posterior margin of metanotum ( Guo & Shi, 2012 : Fig. 15;
Li et al. , 2015
: Fig. 7 ), posterior margin of female subgenital plate nearly straight, emarginate (
Li et al. , 2015
: Fig. 9 ).................................................................................. ..
A. ( B. ) parvospinus ( Liu & Yin, 2002 )
- The black band of dorsal surface of body reaching the apex of abdomen......................................... 13
13 Face with 1 longitudinal black stripe in the middle ( Figs. 5A , 6A , 7A )........................................... 14

- Face without black stripe in middle (
Bian et al. , 2015
: Fig. 4A, H ); posterior margin of female subgenital plate nearly truncate (
Bian et al. , 2015
: Fig. 4L ).............................................
A. ( B. ) nigrigeniculatus ( Liu & Yin, 2002 )

14 Face with 1 longitudinal black stripe in the middle, which connecting the transverse stripe at fastigium verticis, fronto-clypeal suture with 1 pair of black spots ( Figs. 6A , 7A ); posterior margin of female subgenital plate almost straight ( Fig. 7G )...................................................................................
A. ( B. ) tenuispinacia
sp. nov.

- The longitudinal black stripe of face not connecting with the transverse stripe at fastigium verticis (
Bian et al. , 2014
: Figs. 3A, H , 6A, H ), fronto-clypeal suture without black spots......................................................... 15

15 Face with 1 longitudinal black stripe in middle (
Bian et al. , 2014
: Fig. 6A, H ); pronotum and abdominal tergites with 1 black stripe in middle; the apical processes of lateral lobes of male subgenital plate digitate, subapical area of the processes obviously contracted (
Bian et al. , 2014
: Fig. 6F, G )........................................
A. ( B. ) trilobus ( Bian & Shi, 2014 )

- Frons with 1 longitudinal brown stripe in middle ( Fig. 5A ); pronotum and abdominal tergites with 1 black brown stripe in middle; the apical processes of lateral lobes of male subgenital plate stout, subapical area of the processes not contracted (
Bian et al. , 2014
: Fig. 3D, F ); female subgenital plate length equal to wide, posterior margin slightly projected in the middle ( Fig. 5G )........................................................................ ..
A. ( B. ) fallax ( Liu & Bi, 2008 )
